item.title: 日本央行小幅加息或将在全球产生巨大波及效应
item.description:
股市上涨和工资上涨促使官员转向正常政策

。【原文：

Stock market rally and wage hikes encouraged officials to pivot to normal policy

】

item.title: 阿达尼绿色公司称美国腐败调查与第三方无关
item.description: 阿达尼绿色能源有限公司（Adani Green Energy Ltd.）周二提交的一份股票文件显示，该公司尚未收到美国司法部的通知，尽管该公司知道正在对一个无关第三方可能违反美国反腐败法的行为进行调查。【原文：Adani Green Energy Ltd. has not received a notice from the US Department of Justice although it is aware that an investigation is underway for potential violations of American anti-corruption laws by an unrelated third party, according to a stock filing Tuesday.】

item.title: 尼日利亚卡多佐支持上月更大幅度加息
item.description: 尼日利亚央行行长奥拉耶米-卡多佐（Olayemi Cardoso）投票支持比上个月更大幅度的利率上调，这证明他是尼日利亚央行货币政策委员会中最鹰派的成员之一。【原文：Nigerian central bank Governor Olayemi Cardoso voted for an even larger interest-rate increase than was delivered last month, confirming him as one of the most hawkish members on its monetary policy committee.】

item.title: 因电池需求放缓，SK Innovation 被 S&P 评为垃圾股
item.description: 由于电动汽车电池需求放缓和高资本支出将对其债务指标产生负面影响，SK Innovation 公司的信用评级被 S&P 下调为垃圾级。【原文：SK Innovation Co.’s credit rating was cut to junk by S&P as a slowdown in demand for electric vehicle batteries and high capital expenditures are set to negatively impact its debt metrics.】

item.title: 华平投资被指寻求赎回万达购物中心股权
item.description: 据熟悉情况的人士透露，华平投资集团正在寻求赎回其在大连万达集团股份有限公司购物中心部门的投资，该部门近年来曾多次尝试在香港上市，但均以失败告终，因此一直在努力筹集新的资金。【原文：Warburg Pincus is seeking to redeem its investment in Dalian Wanda Group Co.’s shopping mall unit, which has been trying to raise fresh funds after several failed attempts to list in Hong Kong in recent years, according to people familiar with the situation.】

item.title: 美国银行削减香港办公空间，办公楼市场遭受重创
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，美国银行（Bank of America Corp）正在削减其位于香港中环地区总部的部分办公空间，这凸显了香港商业业主所面临的困境。【原文：Bank of America Corp. is cutting some office space in its headquarters in Hong Kong’s Central district, according to people familiar with the matter, underscoring the headwinds for the city’s commercial landlords.】

item.title: 马克龙再次推动巴黎对资本市场的吸引力
item.description: 埃马纽埃尔-马克龙（Emmanuel Macron）承诺将通过新一轮措施使巴黎成为资本市场的避风港，这些措施将为首次公开募股提供便利，并引导更多投资流向小型公司。【原文：Emmanuel Macron pledged to make Paris a haven for capital markets with a fresh round of measures that would facilitate initial public offerings and direct more investment to smaller companies.】

item.title: 交易所调查导致比特币跌至 8,900 美元的闪崩事件
item.description: 加密货币交易所 BitMEX 正在调查昨天导致其平台上比特币闪崩的异常交易活动。【原文：Crypto exchange BitMEX is investigating unusual trading activity that led to a flash crash in Bitcoin on its platform yesterday.】

item.title: 银行家大量涌入，华尔街奖金略有下降
item.description: 去年，华尔街的平均奖金略有下降，原因是在交易持续低迷的情况下，银行对薪酬进行了控制，而证券行业的员工人数也有所增加。【原文：The average Wall Street bonus dropped slightly last year as banks kept compensation reined in amid an ongoing deal slump and the number of employees working in the securities industry ticked up.】

item.title: 日本央行取消负利率，交易大厅一片欢腾
item.description: 当日本央行 17 年来首次提高利率时，从东京到新加坡的交易大厅里回荡着一个词："终于"。【原文：One word echoed across trading floors from Tokyo to Singapore as the Bank of Japan raised rates for the first time in 17 years — ‘finally’.】

item.title: 金多斯称欧洲央行将在 6 月决议中提供 "更多数据
item.description: 欧洲中央银行副行长路易斯-德金多斯（Luis de Guindos）重申，他和他的同事们将掌握更多信息，以便在 6 月份开会时决定利率。【原文：European Central Bank Vice President Luis de Guindos reiterated that he and his colleagues will have much more information to decide on interest rates when they meet in June.】

item.title: 瑞士钟表出口下滑，对中国大陆和香港的出货量减少
item.description: 随着奢侈钟表需求的降温，瑞士钟表月出口量出现了三年来的第二次下降，主要原因是中国和香港的出货量减少。【原文：Monthly Swiss watch exports fell for just the second time in three years, led by lower shipments to China and Hong Kong, as demand for luxury timepieces cools.】

item.title: 美国银行调查显示风险偏好从美国科技股转向欧洲股市
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America Corp）的最新基金经理调查显示，投资者正处于风险偏好情绪中，他们正在抢购欧洲和新兴市场的股票，而牺牲了美国和科技行业的股票。【原文：Investors are in a risk-on mood, and are snapping up stocks in Europe and emerging markets at the expense of the US and the technology sector, according to Bank of America Corp.’s latest fund manager survey.】

item.title: 印度股市在小盘股泡沫和大选中愈发谨慎
item.description: 由于监管机构警告市场泡沫日益严重，印度股市今年的涨幅将被抹去。【原文：Indian stocks are poised to erase gains this year as regulatory warnings of growing froth in the market weigh on sentiment.】

item.title: 媒体报道称，越南要求判处 120 亿美元诈骗案中的大亨死刑
item.description: 据 VnExpress 新闻网站报道，政府检察官向胡志明市人民法院建议，一名因涉嫌贿赂政府官员、违反银行贷款规定和挪用公款而受审的越南房地产大亨应被判处死刑。【原文：A Vietnamese real estate tycoon on trial in a $12 billion fraud case should receive the death penalty for allegedly bribing government officials, violating bank lending regulations and embezzlement, government prosecutors proposed to the Ho Chi Minh City People’s Court, VnExpress news website reported.】

item.title: 南非利率会议前通胀预期下降
item.description: 南非未来两年的通胀预期有所下降，这为央行在下周政策会议前提供了一个好消息，尽管这可能不足以促使央行降息。【原文：South African inflation expectations declined for the next two years, providing the central bank with welcome news ahead of its policy meeting next week though it may not be enough to tempt it to cut interest rates.】

item.title: 奥普拉如何成为减肥药的非官方代言人
item.description: 诺和诺德公司（Novo Nordisk A/S）和礼来公司（Eli Lilly & Co：奥普拉-温弗瑞。【原文：Novo Nordisk A/S and Eli Lilly & Co. have a powerful new ally as they conquer the $80 billion obesity shot market: Oprah Winfrey.】

item.title: 瑞士政府将今年的通胀预测降至 1.5%
item.description: 购物者在苏黎世市中心的班霍夫大街上漫步。【原文：Shoppers walk along Bahnhofstrasse in central Zurich.】

item.title: 中国债券狂潮卷土重来，收益率逼近历史新低
item.description: 中国政府债券近期的牛市在休整一周后卷土重来，这表明交易员们正在接受政策制定者关于涨势过猛的暗示性指导。【原文：A recent bull run in China’s government bonds is making a comeback after a one-week break, a sign that traders are getting over policymakers’ implicit guidance that the rally has gone too far.】

item.title: DFS 家具削减指导并警告红海影响将进一步扩大
item.description: DFS Furniture Plc 将其年度税前利润展望下调了三分之一，并警告说，红海的持续混乱可能会将另外 400 万英镑（500 万美元）的利润推迟到下一个财政年度。【原文：DFS Furniture Plc trimmed its annual pretax profit outlook by a third and warned that continued disruption in the Red Sea could defer another £4 million ($5 million) of profit to the following financial year.】

item.title: 辉瑞出售感康制造商 Haleon 30 亿英镑股份
item.description: 辉瑞公司已经出售了超过 30 亿英镑（38 亿美元）的 Haleon Plc 股份，这是这家英国消费者保健公司的最大股东减持其 32% 股份的第一步。【原文：Pfizer Inc. has sold over £3 billion ($3.8 billion) of shares in Haleon Plc, the first step by the UK consumer health company’s biggest shareholder to reduce its 32% stake.】

item.title: 阿斯利康将以最高 24 亿美元收购 Fusion Pharma
item.description: 阿斯利康公司（AstraZeneca Plc）同意以高达 24 亿美元的价格收购融合制药公司（Fusion Pharmaceuticals Inc.【原文：AstraZeneca Plc agreed to buy Fusion Pharmaceuticals Inc. for as much as $2.4 billion as it seeks to transform cancer treatment by replacing traditional methods like chemotherapy with more targeted approaches.】

item.title: 韩国将为提高股东回报率的企业减税
item.description: 韩国表示，将减轻采取措施提高股东回报的公司的税收负担，以兑现其提高估值和提振当地股市的承诺。【原文：South Korea said it will ease the tax burden for companies that are taking steps to enhance returns for their shareholders, following up on its pledge to improve valuations and boost the local stock market.】

item.title: 印度购买更多美国石油，因为制裁抑制了俄罗斯石油的流入
item.description: 印度炼油厂有望在近一年来吸纳最多的美国原油，因为美国制裁的更严格执行压制了与俄罗斯的贸易，迫使加工商从其他地方寻找供应。【原文：Indian oil refiners are on track to take the most American crude in almost a year after tighter enforcement of US sanctions crimped trade with Russia and forced processors to look elsewhere for supply.】

item.title: 非洲最大交易所的首次公开募股危机终于得到缓解
item.description: 非洲最大的证券交易所约翰内斯堡证券交易所（Johannesburg Stock Exchange）正在慢慢扭转颓势，从退市潮到公司再次考虑首次公开募股。【原文：Africa’s biggest bourse, the Johannesburg Stock Exchange, is slowly turning the tide from a wave of delistings to companies once again considering initial public offerings.】

item.title: 瑞士央行的乔丹仍是百万美元级的央行行长
item.description: 托马斯-乔丹【原文：Thomas Jordan】

item.title: 富时 100 指数直播：英国市场现在的动向
欧洲央行副行长告诉 Naftemporiki，欧洲央行需要等到六月
item.description: 欧洲央行副行长路易斯-德金多斯（Luis de Guindos）在接受希腊报纸《Naftemporiki》采访时说："我们还没有讨论任何有关未来利率走势的问题。我们需要收集更多信息，"欧洲央行副行长路易斯-德金多斯在接受希腊报纸《Naftemporiki》采访时说。"工资的变化是关键，大多数工资谈判协议将在今年前几个月达成。我们将在 6 月份获得更多信息。【原文：“We haven’t yet discussed anything about future rate moves. We need to gather more information,” European Central Bank Vice President Luis de Guindos said in an interview with Greek newspaper Naftemporiki. “The evolution of wages is key and most of the wage bargaining agreements will have been concluded in the first months of this year. We will have more information in June.”】

item.title: 日本央行加息后日本房地产股大涨，银行股下挫
item.description: 周二，在日本央行结束负利率制度的举措被广泛预期后，日本房地产股成为最大赢家，投资者关注的焦点是央行的鸽派基调和通胀前景。【原文：Japan’s real estate shares were the biggest winners on Tuesday after a widely expected move by the Bank of Japan to end its negative rates regime, with investors focusing on the dovish tone by the central bank and the inflation outlook.】

item.title: 瑞士央行在 2023 年底减少支撑法郎的力度
